api package¶

Subpackages¶

  • api.migrations package
    • Module contents

Submodules¶

api.admin module¶

Admin configuration for the API application. Defines how API-related models (if any) are displayed in the Django admin interface.

api.apps module¶

Application configuration for the API application. Defines the metadata and lifecycle hooks for the API component of the news project.

class api.apps.ApiConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]¶

Bases: AppConfig

Configuration for the api app.

name = 'api'¶

api.models module¶

Models for the API application. Stored data specifically required for the API layer that is not part of the core articles or users.

api.renderers module¶

Custom renderers for the API application. Provides support for various output formats, such as XML, to meet diverse client requirements.

class api.renderers.MiniXMLRenderer[source]¶

Bases: BaseRenderer

A minimal XML renderer for DRF.

format = 'xml'¶
media_type = 'application/xml'¶
render(data, accepted_media_type=None, renderer_context=None)[source]¶

Render the provided data into XML format.

api.serializers module¶

Serializers for the API application. Handles the conversion of complex model instances into native Python datatypes for JSON and XML responses.

class api.serializers.ArticleSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for the Article model to be used in API responses.

class Meta[source]¶

Bases: object

fields = ['id', 'title', 'body', 'author', 'publisher', 'published_at']¶
model¶

alias of Article

api.tests module¶

Tests for the API application. Validates the functionality of API endpoints, security permissions, and response formats.

class api.tests.SubscribedArticlesAPITest(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: TestCase

Test suite for the SubscribedArticlesView API endpoint. Validates subscription-based article filtering and authentication.

setUp()[source]¶

Set up test data including users, publishers, articles, and subscriptions.

test_api_returns_xml()[source]¶

Test that the API can return XML format when requested via Accept header.

test_reader_does_not_see_unsubscribed_articles()[source]¶

Test that a reader does not see articles from publishers they are not subscribed to.

test_reader_sees_journalist_subscribed_articles()[source]¶

Test that a reader sees articles from journalists they are subscribed to, even if not subscribed to the publisher.

test_reader_sees_subscribed_articles()[source]¶

Test that a reader can see articles from publishers they are subscribed to.

test_unapproved_articles_not_returned()[source]¶

Test that unapproved articles are not returned in the API response.

test_unauthenticated_user_blocked()[source]¶

Test that unauthenticated users are blocked from accessing the API.

api.urls module¶

URL routing for the API application. Maps API endpoints to their corresponding view classes for resource retrieval.

api.views module¶

Views for the API application. Implements the business logic for responding to API requests and filtering data based on permissions.

class api.views.SubscribedArticlesView(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: APIView

Provides a read-only API endpoint for retrieving published articles.

get(request)[source]¶

Handle GET requests to retrieve articles from subscribed publishers and journalists.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]¶
renderer_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.renderers.JSONRenderer'>, <class 'rest_framework.renderers.BrowsableAPIRenderer'>, <class 'api.renderers.MiniXMLRenderer'>]¶

Module contents¶

Initialization for the API package.
